title: ashley_(pokemon)
body:
[b]Satoko[/b] (Japanese, from "Satoshi"; "-ko" is a feminine suffix), [b]Ashley[/b] (English, from "Ash")

[[Ash Ketchum]], [[crossdressing]] as a [[blonde hair|blonde]] [[long hair|long-haired]] girl, with a pink [[hair bow]] and wearing an [[orange dress]].

First taken to fool the all-female members of the grass-based Celadon Gym after he insulted their perfume side-business. The disguise has recurred since.

h4. See also
* [[Ashley (pokemon bw098)]], Ash's later cross-dressing identity as a pink-hair girl with a blue dress.

title: fubuki_(senran_kagura)
body:
A character who debuts in [[Senran Kagura New Link]]. She is the hybrid child of a human male shinobi and a female Yōma. 

Originally the antagonist, she eventually turns around and becomes a supporting ally to the cast.

Fubuki has [[pale skin|pale pure white skin]] and [[black eyes|dead cold black eyes]] with shadows under them. She possesses [[long hair|long]] [[wavy hair|wavy]] black hair tied in long [[twintails|twin tails]] decorated by a [[white flower]].

In her shinobi clothes, she wears revealing [[black kimono]] clothes mixed with an ankle-lengthened loincloth all lined with gold that reveals her chest and legs, and two small white flowers on her neck and the middle of her chest while the shoulder area has with black stripe straps on both shoulder in which the straps are actually stockings. Like [[yumi (senran kagura)|Yumi]] she uses a [[Fan]] as her weapon, but the mobile game gives it a feathered appearance while the anime simply made it a black version of Yumi's weapon.

Her seiyuu is [[Asumi Kana]]

Hair Color: Black
Eye Color: Black
Height: 170 cm (5'7)
Three Sizes
B95-W:68-H:88
Cup: I

title: tuxedo_cat
body:
A pattern of black/grey and white coating for domestic [[cat]]s, where the upper body is covered in black fur while the lower body (including but not limited to: nose, chin, chest, belly and paws) are white, appears as if the cat is wearing a tuxedo suit.

Two tuxedo cats became fairly popular in [[meme]]s, those being [[Maxwell the Cat]] of [[Spinning Cat (meme)|]] fame, and [[Uni (cat)|]] of Big Boobs fame. Only tag either if it can be explicitly confirmed that the cat in question is one or the other, otherwise stick with this tag only.

title: yagen_toushirou
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character. A [[tantou]] crafted by Awataguchi, and thus one of the many Toushirou brothers. 

In 1493, [[Hatakeyama Masanaga]] tried to commit hara-kiri using this dagger, but he couldn't cut deep into his flesh. He got angry and threw the dagger, and then the dagger pierced directly through a yagen (a stone mill for medicinal herbs). The dagger gained the reputation for never damaging its master but sharp. That's responsible for its name. He was also owned by [[Oda Nobunaga]] at one point. It's said that Yagen was burned down at the Honnō-ji Incident with Nobunaga.

He has [[short hair|short]] [[black hair]] and [[purple eyes]]. His standard outfit is a [[military uniform]], a [[necktie]] and [[black gloves]]. For his Internal Affairs outfit, he wears [[glasses]], a [[lab coat]] and [[suspenders]]. For both outfits he wears [[shorts]] and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

Known for being very mature and reliable, and having a very deep voice despite his youthful appearance. Of course, artists tend to portray him as a precocious kid. Either that, or he's presented as a reliable big brother for the other Awataguchi school tantous when [[ichigo hitofuri|Ichigo]] is away, as he's the only one of them in-game that's been used in combat prior to personification. For this reason he's known as "Aniki" outside of game.

title: crosshatching
body: A shading technique that uses intersecting lines of varying densities to simulate varying levels of darkness. A lightly colored object will have few lines, whereas a very dark object may have so many lines as to be solid black. Crosshatching is a variant of simple [[hatching_(texture)|hatching]] and may have two or more directions in which the lines lie.

title: hatching_(texture)
body:
A drawing technique used for the creation of shadows. Parallel or perpendicular lines are traced over the area to be shaded. Common for [[graphite (medium)|]] and [[pen (medium)|]] illustrations. 

* !post #6273533

h4. Subtypes
** [[Linear hatching]]  [tn]| (post #2199940)[/tn] 
** [[Woven hatching]]  [tn]| (post #7149716)[/tn] 
** [[Crosshatching]]  [tn]| (post #6361083)[/tn] 



h4. See also
* [[halftone]] 
* [[stippling (texture)|]]
* [[traditional media]]
* [[faux traditional media]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Hatching":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hatching]

title: goodsmile_racing
body:
GOODSMILE Racing is a race team and subsidiary of [[GOODSMILE Company]]. The team participates in [[Super GT]]'s GT300 class and has made one-off appearances at the [[Intercontinental GT Challenge]]'s [[circuit de spa-francorchamps|24 Hours of Spa]]. The team currently uses a [[Mercedes-Benz AMG GT]], and fielded the [[Porsche 911]] and [[BMW Z4]] in previous seasons.

Their mascot is [[Racing Miku]], who has a new design released each year. The team's real life [[race queen]]s are known as the "Racing Miku Supporters" and wear outfits based on the Racing Miku design of the year.


h4. External links

* "Official Site":https://www.goodsmileracing.com/en
* "Vocaloid Wiki: Good Smile Racing":http://vocaloid.wikia.com/wiki/Good_Smile_Racing

title: character-themed_food
body:
Food that is shaped like or, less-commonly, printed with an image of a character. Common forms include [[pancake|pancakes]], [[cookie|cookies]], [[ice cream bar|ice cream bars]],  and [[chocolate]] or other [[candy|candies]], but many other foods may be character-shaped as well.

Only use this tag when the food is an [b] inanimate object[/b]. If the food depicts a live character, use [[foodification]] instead. 

h4. See Also: 
* [[creature as food]], when a Pokemon, Pal or other creature IS the food.

title: mg3
body:
A 7.62×51mm NATO derivative of the German [[MG42]], which was adopted by the Bundeswehr. This [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] [[machine gun|general-purpose]] [b][[machine gun]][/b] was designed in 1959 and mainly produced by Rheinmetall AG.
Albeit visually similar to the earlier MG42, its usage context is for modern, post-World War II setting. The MG3 typically comes in all-black or desert tan finish, accessories such as an open [[barrel shroud]], optics, carry handle, and Picatinny rail.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[MG3 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: MG3 machine gun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MG_3_machine_gun

title: negev_ng-7
body:
The Negev NG-7 is an [[Israel]]i 7.62×51mm NATO gas-operated [b][[machine gun]][/b], introduced in 2012. The design is based on the earlier [[IMI Negev|Negev NG-5]] [[light machine gun|LMG]]. 

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* Wikipedia entry: "IWI Negev":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IWI_Negev]

title: sig_mg338
body:
A [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] [b][[machine gun]][/b] manufactured by [[SIG Sauer]], chambered for ".338 Norma Magnum":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.338_Norma_Magnum [[rifle cartridge|cartridge]]. It was intended to bridge the firepower gap between the 7.62x51mm NATO [[machine gun]] and the [[heavy machine gun|heavier]] [[Browning M2]]. 
The SIG Sauer MG 338 features a quick-change barrel, an [[AR-15]]-style adjustable [[folding stock]], and usually seen with a proprietary [[suppressor]].


h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* [[MG338 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "ModernFirearms.net":https://modernfirearms.net//machineguns/u-s-a-machineguns/sig-sauer-mg-338-2/
* "Wikipedia: SIG MG 338":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sig_MG_338

title: fn_mag
body:
The [b]FN MAG[/b] ([i]Mitrailleuse d'Appui Général[/i]) is an open-bolt, gas-operated 7.62×51mm NATO [[machine gun]] designed in the early 1950s at [[FN Herstal]] by Ernest Vervier. In use by over 80 countries, and manufactured under license in many countries, such as Argentina, Egypt, India, Singapore, the United Kingdom and the United States (as the [b]M240[/b]). 

h1. See also
* [[FN Minimi]]
* [[List of weapons]]

h1. External links
* "FN Herstal website":https://fnherstal.com/en/defence/portable-weapons/fn-mag/
* "Wikipedia: FN MAG":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FN_MAG

title: mg34
body:
The [B]MG34[/b] is a 7.92×57mm Mauser [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] [b][[machine gun]][/b] used by Nazi Germany before and during [[World War II]]. Introduced in 1934, it was considered the first [[machine gun]]. It features a quick-change barrel, a tubular [[barrel shroud]] with circular perforation, conical [[muzzle device]] and [[flip-up sight|flip-up iron sights]].
The MG34 was not suitable for quick mass production and costly. So it was supplanted by the [[MG42]] despite both remained in service.

h1. See also
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[MG34 (Girls' Frontline)]]

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: MG34":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MG_34

title: h&k_mg5
body:
The [b]MG5[/b] is an open bolt German [[ammunition belt|belt-fed]] [[machine gun|general-purpose]] [b][[machine gun]][/b] manufactured by [[Heckler & Koch]]. Formerly known as the HK121, it was designed in 2001 in order to supplant the MG3, and was adopted in 2015 by the Bundeswehr.
The MG5 typically comes in desert tan finish, has perforated upper heatshield and its fixed buttstock shape looks similar to the FN Minimi one.

h1. See also
* [[H&K MG4]] [tn](Lighter 5.56mm NATO predecessor)[/tn]
* [[List of Weapons]]
* [[MG5 (Girls' Frontline)]] 

h1. External links
* "Wikipedia: Heckler & Koch MG5":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heckler_%26_Koch_MG5

title: kac_lamg
body:
The KAC Light Assault [[Machine Gun]] (LAMG) is a 5.56×45mm [b][[light machine gun]][/b] system developed by Eugene Stoner and manufactured by Knight's Armament Company (KAC). It is the evolution of the [[Stoner 63]] concept. 
The AMG is the [[machine gun|GPMG]] variant chambered for 7.62×51mm NATO or 6.5 Creedmoor.

h1. See also
* [[List of weapons]]
* "Wikipedia: Knight's Armament Company LAMG":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knight%27s_Armament_Company_LAMG

title: jujube_(fruit)
body: The jujube (scientific name: Ziziphus jujuba), commonly known as red dates, black dates, or Chinese dates, is a small deciduous tree that grows in temperate regions. It is native to central and southern mainland China, the Korean Peninsula, Lebanon, Iran, Pakistan, India, and Bangladesh, and is distributed in various regions of China. Due to its economic value, it has been transplanted to Japan, southern Europe, and North America. The small flowers are rich in nectar, making it a source of honey. The fruit is called jujube, which is oblong in shape. When immature, it is greenish-yellow, resembling a miniature version of green Indian dates, and turns reddish-brown when ripe. Jujubes can be eaten fresh or dried, and can also be made into dried fruits or candied.

title: kote
body:
[i]Kote[/i] are Japanese arm & [[shoulder armor]], a form of armored sleeve usually covering from the forearms all the way to the shoulder.  They are typically made by stitching many small plates into a padded sleeve.

[i]Kote[/i] that only cover the forearms are called [i]han kote[/i], and are also covered by this tag.

[i][[Kurokote]][/i] are a subtype of [i]kote[/i], usually made from black iron plates, which give them their color and name.

title: gainax
body:
[b]Gainax Company, Limited[/b] (株式会社ガイナックス, [i]Kabushiki-gaisha Gainakkusu[/i]) was a Japanese anime studio famous for works such as [[Honneamise No Tsubasa]], [[Top Wo Nerae!]], [[fushigi no umi no nadia|Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water]], [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]], [[FLCL]] and [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]] which have gone on to critical acclaim and commercial success, as well as for their association with award-winning anime director and studio co-founder [[Anno Hideaki]]. The company was headquartered in Koganei, Tokyo, before moving to Mitaka, Tokyo.

The studio was formed in the early 1980s as [[Daicon]] Film by university students [[Anno Hideaki]], [[Sadamoto Yoshiyuki]], Yamaga Hiroyuki, [[Akai Takami]], Okada Toshio, Takeda Yasuhiro, and [[Higuchi Shinji]]. Their first project was to make an animated short for the 20th Annual Japan National SF Convention, also known as [[Daicon III]], held in 1981 in Osaka, Japan. The group made a much bigger splash at the 22nd Annual Japan National SF Convention, [[Daicon IV]], in 1983.

The Daicon IV short firmly established Daicon Film as a talented new anime studio. The studio changed its name to Gainax in 1985, basing the term 'Gainax' on an obscure Tottori Prefecture term for 'giant' and the English suffix 'x'.

Since Gainax originated as a group of fans, it was known for maintaining ties to the general [[otaku]] community, allowing doujinshi of its work, fan-made action figures, and promoting series like Evangelion at private festivals and so on.

Until Neon Genesis Evangelion, Gainax typically worked on stories created in-house, but the studio increasingly developed anime adaptations of existing manga like [[Kareshi Kanojo no Jijou]] and [[Mahoromatic]].

The Animage Anime Grand Prix has been awarded to Gainax for Nadia: The Secret of Blue Water in 1991, Neon Genesis Evangelion in 1995 and 1996, and [[The End of Evangelion]] in 1997.

Much of Gainax's former staff and series left Gainax starting in the late 2000s; notably Anno Hideaki formed [[Studio Khara]] and obtained the rights to Evangelion, several staff members (including those involved in [[Tengen Toppa Gurren Lagann]]) left to make [[Trigger (company)|Studio Trigger]], and Gainax sold their rights to FLCL to I.G. Production. [[gonzo (studio)|Gonzo]] is also made of former Gainax staff, having left in the early 90s.

On May 29, 2024, Gainax filed for bankruptcy with the Tokyo District Court, which was publicly announced over one week later on June 7. The remainder of its properties were split between the various Gainax splinter companies and former staff previously mentioned.

h4. See also

* pool #20604

title: palace_athene
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Zeta Gundam]] from 1985.

[b]PMX-001 Palace Athene[/b]

A custom, one-off [[mobile suit]] designed by [[Paptimus Scirocco]] of the [[titans_(gundam)|Titans]]. While large and capable of loading long range high-powered armament, it suffered in the mobility department.

[spoiler]The unit was piloted by [[Sarah Zabiarov]] and then the AEUG traitor [[Reccoa Londe]]. It was destroyed during the final battle of The Gryps War at the hands of [[Yazan Gable]] and the [[Hambrabi]], mortally wounding [[Emma Sheen]] (who exited her [[Gundam Mk II]] MS so she could check [[Reccoa Londe]]'s condition).[/spoiler]

title: metropolis
body:
[b]Metropolis[/b] ([i]Metoroporisu[/i]) is a classic [[science fiction]] manga created by [[Tezuka Osamu]] and released in 1949. It was adapted into an anime movie in 2001.

The original manga was loosely inspired by a classic 1927 German silent sci-fi movie also called [[Metropolis (fritz_lang)|]]. 

Its anime adaptation, however, was more heavily influenced by the plot of the German film. It was directed by Rintaro, written by [[Ootomo Katsuhiro]] and produced by Madhouse with conceptual support from Tezuka Productions.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolis_(manga)

title: izumi_noa
body:
A fictional [[policewoman]] from near future [[Japan]].

The bubbly, perky [[tomboy]]ish, red-headed gamine labor [[otaku]] from Hokkaidō. The main character of [[kidou_keisatsu_patlabor|Patlabor]], officer [b]Noa Izumi[/b] is usually at the center of the action. Noa loves her labor much like a pet and named it [[alphonse_(av-98_ingram)|"Alphonse"]], a name previously held by a [[pet]] [[dog]] and a pet [[cat]], respectively. 

She's somewhat impulsive, albeit not nearly as much as [[oota_isao|Oota]]. Noa is arguably the best [[mecha]] [[pilot]] in Division 2, although both [[kanuka_clancy|Clancy]] and [[kumagami_takeo|Kumagami]] have shown extreme talent as well but seldom pilot. She has a natural affinity for labors and gets 110% out of them, much to the amazement of her colleagues. Furthermore, she can drink quite a bit more than her co-workers, and recovers from hangovers much faster, since her family runs a liquor store.

body:
When a character's body is passing or leaning halfway through a window frame - possibly to reach something, or to escape an area.

Do not use when the character smashes through a window, use [[breaking through window]] instead.

If the character is leaning on the window, use [[leaning out of window]].

Not to be confused with, though they're not mutually exclusive:
* [[from outside]], a viewpoint from outside through a window.
* [[looking outside]], character is looking through a window.

title: shin_megami_tensei_iii:_nocturne
body:
Shn Megami Tensei: Nocturne (真・女神転生III-NOCTURNE, lit. "True Goddess Reincarnation III-NOCTURNE) is the third game in the [[Shin Megami Tensei]] series. Know as "Shin Megami Tensei: Lucifer's Call" in PAL regions.

In the story, the world comes to an end during an event called the "Conception", whose purpose is to destroy the old world in order to create a new one. The few survivors each possess a 'Reason', an idea of how the new world should be like. The main character, the [[Demi-Fiend]], must then choose which Reason he will support, achieving different endings for the story depending on which one is chosen.

A Director's Cut version of the game was released, named "Shin Megami Tensei: Nocturne Maniax", and featured an additional dungeon, bosses and [[dante_(devil_may_cry)|Dante]] from the [[Devil May Cry (series)|]] series as a recruitable character. It was this version that was localized into english and released outside of Japan.

Another version of the game, called "Shin Megami Tensei: Nocturne Chronicles" was released alongside a limited edition of [[Devil Summoner (series)|]]: Raidou Kuzunoha vs. King Abbadon, where [[Kuzunoha Raidou]] replaced Dante as the special recruitable character.

h4. Characters

* [[Demi-Fiend]]
* [[Nitta Isamu]]
* [[Tachibana Chiaki (megami Tensei)|]]

h4. See also

* [[Shin Megami Tensei I]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei II]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei: if...]]
* [[Shin Megami Tensei: Strange Journey]] (Shin Megami Tensei IV)

title: ippon-datara_(megami_tensei)
body:
A demon from the [[shin_megami_tensei|Shin Megami Tensei]] video game series, based on Japanese [[traditional youkai]] with the same name. It mainly appeared in [[Devil Summoner (series)|]] series.

title: blue_impulse_(team)
body:
ブルーインパルス (Blue Impulse) is a nickname of the aerobatic demonstration team of the [[Japan Air Self-Defense Force]]. Its official name is "JASDF 11th Squadron".

The team has used the [[f-86 sabre|F-86]]F and the [[Mitsubishi t-2]] in the past, and is currently using the [[Kawasaki t-4]].

title: admiral_(kancolle)
body:
The player character in [[Kantai Collection]]. 

Most admirals wear a [[naval uniform]] with a [[peaked cap]] and [[epaulettes]]. If not caught in those, they usually have on a [[dress shirt]] instead.

This tag is for male admirals only. See [[female admiral (kancolle)|Female Admiral]] for female depictions of the admiral. 

The iteration of the admiral in the second [[Kantai Collection]] anime series: "Itsuka Ano Umi de" (いつかあの海で) is nicknamed [[Admiral Narita (Kancolle)|]].

title: hisamura_natsuki_(munmu-san)
body:
A male [[admiral (kancolle)|admiral]] who features in [[Munmu-san]]'s [[Kantai Collection]] comics. According to "his profile":[/posts/2872216], he used to be a major in the army before being seconded to the navy (making him a lieutenant commander now). He came into command over a newly established base for training shipgirls with ground-combat capabilities.

Notable for "having personally participated in building his base from scratch":[/posts/2436991], and being unusually comfortable around the shipgirls under his command (and vice versa, for the most part), to the point that it's normal to see him [[mixed-sex bathing|bathing alongside them]] (to the shock of "newcomers":[/posts/2757604]).

Skills: Ranger, Airborne, CQC, marksmanship, skiing, and a variety of other disciplines.

Preference in female swimsuits: [[wetsuit]] (practical); [[bikini]] and [[competition swimsuit]] (personal)

title: sentry
body:
[i]I love that little gun![/i]
-- [[Engineer (tf2)|]] on his Combat Mini-Sentry Gun

A weapon that is automatically aimed and fired at targets that are detected by sensors. Commonly associated with the Engineer from [[Team Fortress 2]] due to the Sentry Gun he can build. Enemies that get close to it will get shot and receive a lot of damage.

h4. TF2 Levels and Weaponry

* Level 1 = Semi-Automatic Firing Barrel
* Level 2 = Dual Rotational Minigun Barrels
* Level 3 = Dual Rotational Minigun Barrels + Target Guided Rocket Launch Support System
* Mini-Sentry = Semi-Automatic Firing Barrel

h4. See also

* [[Mimi-sentry (flyingpiggles)|]]
* [[Mini-sentry-chan (fizzywattr)|]]

title: colosseum
body:
Originally the [b]Flavian Amphitheatre[/b], an elliptical amphitheatre in the centre of the city of [[Rome (city)|]], [[Italy]], the largest ever built in the Roman Empire, built of concrete and stone. It is considered one of the greatest works of Roman architecture and Roman engineering and is also famous as a [[gladiator]]ial arena. The name is derived from the Colossus of Rhodes, a giant statue of Apollo which stood near (but not inside) the Amphitheatre.

Note that this tag is not limited to the [[real life]] colosseum, as it also includes fantastical depictions of an [[arena]] inspired after the real life arena.

h4.See also

* [[Arena]]

title: postal_(game)
body:
[b]Postal[/b] is a shooter game franchise created by Running with Scissors, known for its excessive violence and controversial content. The games follow the misadventures of the Postal Dude, the cynical anti-hero who tries to survive everyday life while dealing with an ever changing cast of crazy characters and defending himself from rude civilians, rabid police, violent rednecks, terrorists, crazy protestors, wild animals, zombies, robots and other sort of enemies. 

To date, there are four Postal games which include:

* Postal
* Postal 2
* Postal III
* Postal 4: No Regerts

title: ren_&_stimpy
body: The Ren & Stimpy Show (also known as Ren & Stimpy) is an American animated television series created by Canadian animator John Kricfalusi. Originally produced by Spümcø for [[Nickelodeon]], the series aired from August 11, 1991, to December 16, 1995, with a total of five seasons and 52 episodes. The series follows the adventures of the title characters: [[Ren Hoek|Ren Höek]], an emotionally unstable and sociopathic dog; and [[Stimpy]], a good-natured yet dimwitted cat.

title: corona_borealis_(constellation)
body:
Corona Borealis (the Northern [[Crown]]) is a small [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. Its brightest star is Alphecca. The constellation has a southern counterpart, [[Corona Australis (constellation)|]] (the Southern Crown).

Corona Borealis consists of seven connected stars resembling the letter [b]u[/b]. In rare cases, it can also be made up of six stars.

h5. Example shapes
* !asset #21432300
* !asset #21432302: Rare

h5. Example posts
* post #6516596, bottom left corner (blurry)
* post #6740198, above blue ribbon

h5. Neighboring constellations
* [[Bootes (constellation)|]]
* [[Hercules (constellation)|]]
* [[Serpens (constellation)|Serpens Caput]]

h4. External links
* "eSky: Corona Borealis":https://www.glyphweb.com/esky/constellations/coronaborealis.html
* "Wikipedia: Corona Borealis":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corona_Borealis
* "Study-Style (JP): Corona Borealis":https://www.study-style.com/seiza/CrB.html

title: lyra_(constellation)
body:
Lyra (the [[Harp]] or [[Lyre]]) is a small [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. It symbolizes the lyre of "Orpheus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Orpheus, the legendary musician in Greek mythology. Its brightest star is [[Vega (star)|]], part of the "Summer Triangle":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Summer_Triangle.

Lyra forms a parallelogram with a line attached to the corner and ending with its brightest star. Sometimes the line takes the shape of a 7 or changes to a triangle. 

h5. Example shapes
* !asset #21153900
* !asset #21153901

h5. Example posts

* post #4578563, upper left corner

title: enkidu_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is a member of [b]Amnesia[/b] who was hired by [[Hilda (Under Night In-Birth)|Hilda]] and seeks out strong In-Births throughout the Hollow Night. He crosses paths with the likes of [[Waldstein (under night in-birth)|]] and [[Gordeau (under night in-birth)|]], both of whom he considers worthy opponents. His real name is [i]Gaien Enkidou[/i] ([b]円鬼堂凱庵[/b]).

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] [[Takeuchi Shunsuke]]


h4. External links

* "Enkidu Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Enkidu

title: waldstein_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. An old man with relation to both the Night Blade and Licht Kreis. He accompanies [[Linne (under night in-birth)|]] in her search for a means to end her life. Originally a part of Licht Kreis; Waldstein crossed Kuon on the battlefield, after absorbing several amounts of [b]EXS (Exist)[/b], Waldstein began to mutate into a Void. Kuon fortunately drives most of the EXS out of his body. Waldstein, thankful for Kuon saving his life; is now in debt to him and accompanies Kuon's sister, Linne, as part of Kuon's final request.

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] Ishii Kouji [b]EN:[/b] Keith Silverstein


h4. External links

* "Waldstein Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Waldstein#Official

title: chaos_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is a tactician who works for the organization, Amnesia. He is good friends with [[Gordeau (under night in-birth)|]] and wants help him track down [i][[Erika Wagner|The Crimson Knight]][/i]. His book, [i]The Codex of Disorder: Chaos Code[/i], allows him to command a lizard-shaped beast Void known as Azhi Dahaka. His EXS, Umbral, allows him to manifest creatures from books. Chaos is also known by the alias, [i][b]Bloody Chaos[/b][/i] which he isn't very found of. His real name is [b]Kei Asuma[/b] [b](明日真景)[/b].

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] [[Matsuoka Yoshitsugu]]


h4. External links

* "Chaos Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Chaos

title: gordeau_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is a former member and one of the founders of Amnesia. Nowadays, he works as a mercenary on behalf of them. Ever since the transformation of his friend, Roger, who became a Void and was killed at the hands of [i][[Erika Wagner|The Crimson Knight]][/i], He developed a vendetta against her and the rest of Licht Kreis. He is good friends with fellow Amnesia member [i][[Chaos (Under Night In-Birth)|Bloody Chaos]][/i] and a former friend of [i][[Hilda (Under Night In-Birth)|Paradox]][/i].  

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] [[Toriumi Kousuke]] [b]EN:[/b] Ian Sinclair


h4. External links

* "Gordeau Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Gordeau

body:

A small [[dragon]]-like [[creature]] that follows [[Linne (under night in-birth)|]] around, likening it to a [[pet]].

title: kido_hyde
body:
Lead and male protagonist of [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is the wielder of [i]“Indulgence of Insulation”[/i] "[b][i]The Insulator[/i][/b]":https://www.pixiv.net/search.php?word=断裂の免罪符%28インスレーター%29 and a second year student at an unnamed high school. He attends the same high school as [[Orie ballardiae harada|Orie]], [[Seth (Under Night in-Birth)|Seth]] and [[Carmine (under night in-birth)|]]. [[Linne (under night in-birth)|]] saved his life when he was attacked by a void. After being bit by the void he became an In-Birth, gaining supernatural powers and the ability to wield the Insulator. Linne entrusts him with the sword so that one day, when the time comes, he may take her life and finally end her cycle of reincarnation.

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] [[Kimura Ryouhei]] [b]EN:[/b] [[Kyle McCarley]]


h4. External links

* "Hyde Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Hyde

title: seth_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is an assassin who currently works for an unknown client. A long time ago, Seth's ancestors were one of the many families that fought among each other in Night Blade. He also has some connection with [[Linne (under night in-birth)|]], as he wishes to save her from her curse of reincarnation. To achieve this, he seeks out [i]The Insulator[/i] who currently resides with [[Kido hyde|Hyde]], which leads to them clashing in the events of the story. While Hyde doesn't want to end Linne's life just yet, Seth insists that he ends her life as soon as possible.

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] [[Kaji Yuuki]] [b]EN:[/b] [[Mark Whitten]]

title: creepypasta
body:
Urban legends or scary stories circulating on the Internet, many times revolving around specific videos, pictures or video games. The term "creepypasta" is a mutation of the term "copypasta": a short, readily available piece of text that is easily copied and pasted into a text field. "Copypasta" is derived from "copy/paste", and in its original sense commonly referred to presumably initially sincere text (e.g. a blog or forum post) perceived by the copy/paster as undesirable or otherwise preposterous, which was then copied and pasted to other sites as a form of trolling.

(Source: Wikipedia)

h4. Examples of creepypastas
* [[Ben Drowned]]
* [[Jeff the Killer]]
* [[Slender Man]]
* The [[Backrooms (creepypasta)|]]
* [[Sonic.exe]]

title: rain_world
body:
Rain World is a unforgiving survival platform game, featuring breath-taking pixel art scenery. The player takes the role of a creature called a [[slugcat]] trying to survive in an alien, post-apocalyptic ecosystem. It was developed by Videocult and published by Adult Swim Games and Akupara Games in 2017.

body:
[quote]The music [[deemo (character)|you]] [[alice (deemo)|two]] are playing is really hard on the ears.[/quote]

title: deemo_(character)
body:
[quote]...[/quote]

[quote][[Alice (deemo)|Girl]]: (I don't know what he's saying, but he seems friendly.)[/quote]

The titular focus of the game [[Deemo]]. A thin, silhouette-like humanoid that accompanies the [[Alice (deemo)|Girl]] in the world she falls into. They work to discover and play songs on a piano sprouting out of it, in the hopes of making it grow large enough to allow the Girl to climb back through the window she came from.

[spoilers]Is later revealed to be the mental manifestation of [[Hans (deemo)|Hans]], the Girl's older brother and an expert pianist who died saving her life in a traffic accident.[/spoilers]

title: tablet_pc
body:
A tablet computer, commonly just called a tablet, is a portable [[computer]] housed within the casing of a handheld touchscreen display.  They appear like a larger version of the modern [[smartphone]].

Unlike [[laptop|laptops]], tablet computers lack a built-in [[computer keyboard|keyboard]].  Should not be confused with a 2-in-1 laptop, which is a laptop that features a touchscreen with the ability to flip or rotate so the display can conceal the laptop keyboard.

A popular example of a tablet computer is the [[iPad]].

Should not be confused with a [[drawing tablet]], which is a computer input device that enables a user to hand-draw images on a computer.

h4. See also

* [[Tourbox]]

title: computer_tower
body: Also called a computer case, this is the enclosure that contains most of the components of a [[computer]] excluding the [[monitor]], [[computer keyboard|keyboard]] and [[computer mouse|mouse]].

title: angry_german_kid
body:
The "Angry German Kid" is the main character in a viral video, depicting a young teen having a violent temper tantrum when things don't go his way in a video game.

In reality, the video was staged, and was intended by its creator (the teen who plays the Angry German Kid) as a parody of what many people feared, that violent video games would lead to gamers being violent.  It is one of a series of videos made by the teen, who parodies other societal phenomena such as the "gangster".  However, when the video was played on German TV, the TV producers lied and told the audience that this was an unstaged incident, secretly taped by the boy's father.

In Japan, he is referred to as the “[[computer keyboard|KeyBoard]] Crusher” or “KBC”.

http://knowyourmeme.com/memes/angry-german-kid-keyboard-crasher
other_names: キーボードクラッシャー

title: cpu
body:
The [b]central processing unit[/b], the "brains" of a [[computer]].

In Danbooru, it actually refers to the case that houses the actual CPU chip, the motherboard on which it is mounted, other components soldered to the motherboard in order for the computer to function, its power supply, and various input/output ports into which peripherals (such as a [[computer keyboard]], [[computer mouse]], display [[monitor|]], and/or [[printer]]) are connected . Most of the time, these cases are referred to as part of a desktop personal computer, are rectangular, and are either vertical or horizontal.

title: chads_dancing_to_california_gurls_(meme)
body:
[b]Chads Dancing To California Gurls In Friday the 13th: The Game[/b] is a viral video trend in which players of [[Friday the 13th]]: The Game perform the "shake it" emote in front of [[Jason Voorhees]] using the [[Chad Kensington]] character while wearing the "spring break 1984" clothing with [[Katy Perry]]'s "[[California Gurls]]" playing in the background. The trend has spread outside the game, which has resulted in live-action fan videos involving the dance, as well as videos of characters from other video games performing the dance.

title: zssa
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] TV series from 1986.

[b]AMX-102 Zssa[/b]

Small artillery type [[mobile_suit|MS]] created by [[Neo Zeon]]. As it was supposed to work in tandem with the close-quarters type [[Galluss-J]], it was loaded to the utter brim with [[missile]]s, guns and all sorts of extra ranged armament, serving as support. However, the Zssa was severely lacking in the melee combat area, so it required obligatory escort from raid capable [[mecha]] for each of its missions.

title: skin_suit_(stellar_blade)
body:
A [[bodysuit]] outfit for [[eve_(stellar_blade)|Eve]] in [[Stellar Blade]].

As its name suggests, it is a skin-colored bodysuit that [[revealing clothes|exposes large amount of skin of the wearer]], which combined with the color of the suit itself (with the "skin" part of the suit suggestively covering Eve's breasts and [[ass]]) can make Eve appears as if she was naked.

Not recommended for new players as it greatly increases the damage Eve takes, making the game considerably more difficult.

h5. In-game description:
[i]"Changes the appearance of Eve. Skin suits are outfits specifically crafted by Mother Sphere. It covers the body of Airborn Squad Member and deploys on its own, or expands and contracts depending on the situation. In other words, it's like a living skin. (Shield is disabled when you put on this Skin Suit.)"[/i]

title: akatsuki_(akatsuki_blitzkampf)
body:
h5. [[Akatsuki Blitzkampf]]

A High class technical officer of the Imperial army. Believed to have died in the Arctic oceans at a critical time when the war was coming to its end, during the transportation of a new military unit from an allied country. Fifty years later, he returns alive and unchanged in appearance. Now wielding superhuman abilities, he resumes his mission.

h5. [[Under Night In-Birth]]

Guest character in [b]Under Night In-Birth[/b]. He gets involved in the Hollow Night while traveling to [[Mount Fuji]] to destroy the Blitz Motors. He fights many In-Births along the way, often times being mistaken for a [[cosplay|cosplayer]]. He apparently gets really [[hungry]] when ever he taps into his Blitz Motor. 

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] Matsumoto Shinobu [i](credited as "Hijikata Shouji" in Akatsuki Blitzkampf)[/i] [b]EN:[/b] [[Kaiji Tang]]


h4. External links

* "Akatsuki Mizuumi Entry":https://wiki.gbl.gg/w/Akatsuki_Blitzkampf/Akatsuki
* "Akatsuki Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Akatsuki

title: erika_wagner
body:
Character in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. She is the 4th Executor of Licht Kreis and she is best known as [b]"The Crimson Knight"[/b] . Her family has served Licht Kreis for centuries, acting as the "blades" that smite their enemies. Among all the members of Licht Kreis, she is the most feared and ruthless fighter of all the Executors, perpetuated by her bloodlust and utter brutality against her foes. She also seems to have a rivalry with [[Orie ballardiae harada|Orie]].

h5. Voice Actresses

[b]JP:[/b] [[Ishigami Shizuka]]


h4. External links

title: phonon_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. She is a senior middle school student who is childhood friends with [[Nanase (Under Night In-Birth)|Nanase]], although they have grown apart as of late. Phonon has an interest in supernatural phenomena and has several [[chuunibyou]] tendencies which is partly how she became an In-Birth. Her real name is [b]Yoshiko (良子)[/b]. She was originally based on the scrapped character idea, [b]Chemeti[/b].

h5. Voice Actresses

title: byakuya_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is an enigma, following along with his sister, [[Tsukuyomi (Under Night In-Birth)|Tsukuyomi]], as they wander through the Hollow Night. He has no other motive other than to follow his sister's orders, usually involving him sinking the [[claws]] of his EXS, [i]Chelicerata[/i], into unwary victims. [spoiler]It is revealed that he knew Tsukuyomi was in fact, not his real sister. However, he is still willing to help her find what she's searching for.[/spoiler] Fans often liken his appearance to [[Narukami Yuu]] of [i][[Persona]][/i] fame.

h5. Voice Actors

[b]JP:[/b] [[Tamura Mutsumi]]


h4. External links

* "Byakuya Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Byakuya

title: nanase_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. She is a middle school student who became an In-Birth after run-in with [[Kido hyde|Hyde]]. After waking up and realizing what she'd become, she was mortified and wanted to get revenge on Hyde, believing he had "defiled" her. During the Hollow Night, she comes across other girls who she also believed to be "defiled" by Hyde, which makes her even more furious as to why they are "protecting" him. [spoiler]By the end of it all, she becomes a [[tsundere]] towards Hyde, after realizing that her powers aren't permanent.[/spoiler]

h5. Voice Actresses

[b]JP:[/b] Iizuka Mayu


h4. External links

* "Nanase Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Nanase

title: yuzuriha_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. She is a cheerful young lady whose family has ties to the faction, Night Blade. She uses a type of Iaijutsu technique that is learned by descendants of her family. She affectionately calls her sword "Ayame-chan". Yuzuriha and [[Kido hyde|Hyde]] were once childhood friends until an unspecified incident occurred which split them apart from each other. Hyde, to this day, he still feels guilty about what happened that day.

title: merkava_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is a Void that still retains it's conscious. Usually, a Void would lose all of it's semblance to it's humanity after absorbing high amounts of EXS ([b]Exist[/b]); this is not the case with Merkava however, as he attempted to become a Re-Birth but failed, instead turning him into what he is now. Instead of EXS, Merkava posses FLS ([b]False[/b]), whom primarily feed on EXS in order to survive.

title: orie_ballardiae_harada
body:
[b]Orie Ballardiae (オリエ・バラーディア)[/b], known by her Japanese alias as [b]"Harada Orie" (原田織依)[/b], is a character in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. She is an Executor of Licht Kreis who sent to investigate the high influx of In-Birth activity in Kanzakai. She is sent on an undercover mission by Zenith in order to keep an eye on Amnesia's activities. At the same time she continues her studies in the same school as [[Kido hyde|Hyde]]. Her parents were murdered by a Void when she was young, it's one of many reasons she fights to protect people from the dangers of the Hollow Night. She has a close relationship with her classmate, Hyde, as he affectionately calls her "Harada". Orie also visits Hyde often to cook for him and help him with homework.  

h5. Voice Actresses

[b]JP:[/b] [[Hayami Saori]] [b]EN:[/b] [[Erica Mendez]]


h4. External links

* "Orie Under Night In-Birth Wiki Entry":http://in-birth.wikia.com/wiki/Orie
other_names: オリエ・バラーディア

title: carmine_(under_night_in-birth)
body:
Character who appears in [[Under Night In-Birth]]. He is an unallied [b]In-Birth[/b] who fights just for his own enjoyment. His EXS ability allows him to manipulate and weaponize his own blood. His violent tendencies quickly earned him a reputation on the streets of Kanzakai as [i][b]Carmine-Prime[/b][/i]. He is motivated by making others feel pain and revels in suffering of others. He attends the same school as [[Kido hyde|Hyde]]. Hyde and Carmine often trade insults with each other, such as Hyde calling him [i]"Crawfish"[/i], and Carmine calling him [i]"Clownfish"[/i].

title: backrooms_(creepypasta)
body:
A creepypasta originating on [[4chan]] where people can randomly clip out of reality into a world of endless, randomly generated rooms featuring little more than recessed ceiling lights and yellow walls/carpets. The original post also implies that these rooms are not devoid of life, which should be avoided at all costs.

First popularized in 2019, and spread onto Japanese accounts in early 2022. Later became an international [[meme]] in the middle of 2022.

Fans have since expanded the concept and formed several communities based on different versions of the Backrooms with different expanded lore.

h4. Tagged entities

* [[Bacteria (backrooms)|]]
* [[Kitty (backrooms)|]]
* [[Partygoer (backrooms)|]]
* [[Smiler (backrooms)|]]

body:
Dress pants are a style of pants intended as formal or semi-formal wear. They are often made of either wool or polyester and may be designed to be worn with a matching suit jacket. 
Dress pants should have many or all of the following: 
* A straight cut down the leg
* A defined waistband with belt loops 
* Two front and two back pockets only
* One to three pleats
* A fly with a zipper and button or clasp fastener

title: red-crowned_crane
body:
Latin: [i]Grus japonensis[/i]
JP: タンチョウヅル ([i]tanchou-dzuru[/i])

A rare, endangered East Asian [[crane (animal)|]] species, distinctive for the red patch on its head which is actually bare, brightly-colored skin. This plus the black neck, white streak leading from the red crown partially down the neck, and white body make them easy to identify. This crane is one of the largest crane species.

Overall, they are snow white with black secondary flight feathers (in flight, these are the row of largest feathers present on the "lower arm" of the wing). This can appear like a fluffy black tail when the birds are standing, but the real tail feathers as well as the primary flight feathers are actually white. The bill is olive green to greenish horn, the legs are slate to grayish black.

Males are black on the cheeks, throat, and neck, while females are pearly gray in these spots. 

Some artistic renditions may show a black tail or black primary flight feathers if the artist did not reference a photo or accurate illustration of the bird in flight. Regardless, if the crane has a red forehead or a line delineating this marking, it is almost certainly a red-crowned crane.

In Taoism this crane is a symbol of longevity and immortality. It also symbolizes luck and fidelity.

h4. Examples
* !asset #21402899: Photo reference: Full body
* !asset #21402898: Photo reference: Head
* !asset #21402900: Photo reference: In flight
* !post #371053

h4. See also
* [[Crane (animal)]]
* [[Tag Group:Birds]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Red-crowned crane":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red-crowned_crane

title: muli
body:
Muli(幕篱) is a type of hat worn in ancient China. Initially, both muli and wimao were designed to shield against sand and wind. Later, they became hats worn by women while traveling to conceal their faces and prevent passersby from peeking.

The muli(幕篱)  features a gauze veil fully attached to the brim of the hat, hanging down to shield the entire body; while the wimao has a net hanging around its four edges, draping down to the neck with additional decorations of pearls and jade often added to the net veil.

title: anpanman
body:
[b]Anpanman[/b] (Anime title: Soreike! Anpanman! (それいけ!アンパンマン); Bread Man Anpanman!) is a children's manga and anime series created by Takashi Yanase. First published in 1982, it became one of the longest running TV shows in Japan. Despite its limited success abroad, it is the second most successful anime series of all time (after [[Doraemon]]) due to its wide range of merchandises.

The story involves [[Anpanman (character)|]], an anthromorpic [[anpan]] bread who lives with other various [[personification|anthromorphic]] breads, and their fight against his [[devil]] nemesis [[Baikinman]].
other_names: それいけ!アンパンマン

title: layered_kimono
body:
A layered kimono was an extremely elegant and highly complex [[kimono]] that was only worn by court ladies in Japan.

This tag will be used to describe Kimono that were prevalent to the [b]Heian period[/b], such as the [i]juunihitoe[/i] (十二単衣) "twelve-layer robe" and other robes that have lesser layers (usually 5). 

Kimono undergarments are known as juban (襦袢).

* [[japanese clothes]]
* [[karaginu mo]]

title: fifty_shades_of_grey
body:
[b]Fifty Shades of Grey[/b] is a 2011 erotic romance novel by British author E. L. James. It became the first installment in the Fifty Shades novel series that follows the deepening relationship between a college graduate, Anastasia Steele, and a young business magnate, Christian Grey. It contains explicitly erotic scenes featuring elements of sexual practices involving [[BDSM]].

It later received a movie adaptation in 2013, which was generally panned for its heavy focus on sex scenes while leaving much of its plot to be desired.

title: ewok
body:
A [[Star Wars]] [[alien]] race.
The Ewoks are sentient furred bipeds native to the moon of Endor. They are curious individuals that stand about one meter tall. They are extremely skilled in forest survival and the construction of primitive technology like gliders and catapults. They are quick learners when exposed to advanced technology, however. The Ewoks accepted members of the Rebel Alliance into their tribe, and allied themselves to their cause. The Ewoks helped in the ground battle to destroy the Imperial shield generator built in their forests, and their primitive weapons felled the stormtroopers and the scout walkers of the Empire. Their help paved the way to victory at the Battle of Endor.

By 35 ABY, Warrick had a son named Pommet, with whom he watched the uprising on Endor.

title: luke_skywalker
body:
Main protagonist of the original trilogy of [[Star Wars]] [[science fiction|Sci-Fi]] and [[Fantasy]] series.
 
He was played by American actor [[Mark Hamill]] in the three original films from the 70s and 80s and also in the new sequel trilogy of films and net series produced by [[Disney]], he even played Luke in some parodies like [[Robot Chicken]] and [[Family Guy]].

Luke Skywalker is a farm boy from the backwater world of Tatooine who famously destroys the [[Death Star]] and becomes the Rebel Alliance's greatest hero. Under the guidance of [[Obi-Wan Kenobi]] and [[Yoda]], Luke learns about his family as the son of fallen Jedi [[Anakin Skywalker]], and learns the ways of the Force, becoming a [[Jedi]] himself.

His happiness and purpose in life was restorán thanks to the efforts of [[Smiling Friends]] Pim and Charlie. [[Mike Stoklasa]] is the voice of Desmond.

title: scarlet_macaw
body:
Latin: [i]Ara macao[/i]
JP: コンゴウインコ [i](kongō-inko)[/i]

A large red, yellow, and blue [[macaw]] with a particularly long tail. This parrot is mostly bright scarlet red, with large yellow wing patches, mostly blue wings and rump, and large white facial markings. The upper beak mandible is pale above and black below and the lower beak is black, leading to an impression that there is a black stripe dividing the beak from the face.

This parrot is native to Central and South America.

Not to be confused with [[red-and-green macaw]].

title: macaw
body:
JP: コンゴウインコ [i](kongō-inko)[/i]

Macaws are colorful, long-tailed [[parrot|parrots]] with proportionally large, powerful beaks. There are 19 species in various colors, including combinations of red, green, yellow and blue. 

Most macaw species have white or white-striped-with-black facial patches which are as unique as fingerprints, though some such as the [[hyacinth macaw]] have sparse color highlights instead.

When tagging macaws some confusion may exist between [[red-and-green macaw]] and [[scarlet macaw]] as they are both large, red macaws with blue wing tips, the way to tell them apart is that the [[scarlet macaw]] has a bright yellow area in the middle of the wings while the [[red-and-green macaw]] as the name suggests has green and blue wing tips.

Visual comparison can be seen here: https://i.pinimg.com/originals/de/b1/05/deb105e83abdfb1d03882e70b9505220.jpg

h4. Macaw Species on Danbooru
* !post #6821401: [[Blue-and-yellow macaw]]
* !post #6153447: [[Hyacinth macaw]]
* !post #6208204: [[Red-and-green macaw]]
* !post #4767468: [[Scarlet macaw]]

h4. See also
* [[Tag Group:Birds]]

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Macaw":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macaw
* "Wikipedia: List of macaws":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_macaws

title: minoan_clothes
body:
Clothing of the Minoan civilization, an ancient civilization located on the isle of Crete, [[Greece]]. Men are topless and usually wear a decorated feathered hat and wrappings around their waist, while women wear an [[open dress]] that [[revealing clothes|exposes]] their [[breasts]], which is speculated to be a symbol of beauty and fertility of the Minoan culture. Most clothing is colorful and elaborately decorated.

h4. See also
* [[Ancient greek clothes]]

title: object_on_head
body:
An object that isn't conventional headgear atop someone's head. If it the object cover's the wearers face, such as a bag, use an [i]over head[/i] tag, such as [[bag over head]] instead of [[bag on head]].

Use this tag for [b]objects that seem spontaneously placed on the character's head[/b], rather than fashioned into a head accessory (such as commonly found in  [[necktie on head]], where the necktie is fashioned into a headband). 

- Another example, if there is fruit on a character's hat, but it seems ingrained to the hat's design, use [[Fruit hat ornament]]; if the fruit seems to be attached to their hair, use [[Fruit hair ornament]], but if it looks like the fruit has been randomly placed on their head, use [[fruit on head]].

h4. Containers
* [[Bag on head]]
* [[Basket on head]]
* [[Bottle on head]]
* [[Box on head]]
* [[Bucket on head]]
* [[Cup on head]]
* [[Nest on head]]

title: yahweh
body:
The Abrahamitic (i.e. the deity worshiped in the religions Judaism, Christianity and Islam) God. Also known as יהוה (YHWH) or "The Lord". Although considered a spirit (John 4:24) existing beyond space and time, God is commonly depicted as an old man with a [[white hair|white]] [[beard]] and [[robe]]s.

For the enemy in [[Megami Tensei II]] or [[Shin Megami Tensei II]], use the [[YHVH (Megami Tensei)|]] tag.

title: yhvh_(megami_tensei)
body:
[[yahweh|The Abrahamic God Himself]] as a demon in the [[Megami Tensei]] series.

One of most important figures in the series as a whole, he was depicted as a yellow masculine head with [[pointy ears]] and [[red eyes]] with [[black sclera|black sclerae]].
As of [[shin megami tensei iv final|Shin Megami Tensei IV: Apocalypse/Final]], he is a prismatic entity with completely blank eyes.

body: One of [[Kyokutei Bakin_(fate)|]]'s Eight Dog Warriors in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The [[Shiba Inu]] possessing the Kou bead ("piety"), and Bakin's bio states that he "is either majestic or shameless, depending on who you ask." For reference, see post #5810872.

title: genpachi_(fate)
body: One of [[Kyokutei Bakin_(fate)|]]'s Eight Dog Warriors in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The [[Golden Retriever]] possessing the Shin bead ("faith"), and Bakin's bio states that he is "one of the younger dogs who nonetheless possesses great strength." For reference, see post #5810872.

title: sousuke_(fate)
body: One of [[Kyokutei Bakin (fate)|]]'s Eight Dog Warriors in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. The [[Bernese Mountain Dog]], and the first of the dogs seen in the Nanmei Yumihari event. He possesses the Gi bead ("duty"), and Bakin's bio states that Sousuke is "a worldly dog who tends to miss out on many things because of his cautious, reserved nature." [[Okada Izou (fate)|]] quickly warms up to Sousuke, jokingly calling him Dustcloth. For reference, see post #5810872.

title: bernese_mountain_dog
body:
A large dog breed originating from Bern, Switzerland. It is a large, heavy dog with a distinctive tri-coloured coat, black with white chest and rust-coloured markings above eyes, sides of the mouth, front of legs, and out around the white chest.

[[Fate/Grand Order]]'s [[Sousuke (fate)|]] is a Bernese Mountain Dog.

title: kyokutei_bakin_(fate)
body:
Rider-class Servant introduced in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. This is the pen name of [b]Takizawa Bakin[/b], a novelist from the Edo period who wrote [i]The Eight Dog Chronicles[/i] and [i]Strange Tales of the Crescent Moon[/i]. However, Fate's Bakin is actually his daughter-in-law Tokimura Michi using her father-in-law's True Name and abilities, similar to what [[Katsushika Hokusai (fate)|]] does. In particular, Michi undergoes a transformation to that of Fusehime from [i]Eight Dog Chronicles[/i] in her Third Ascension, since it was partially written by her after Bakin went blind and dictated the final parts to her to write down.

title: track_ballast
body: Track ballast are the hard material that are used to absorb the compression load and vibration of [[railroad tracks]] as the [[train]] move along them, so that the tracks won't often break down and need repair immediately. Track ballast are different from [[rock]] and [[concrete]] that are not used for railway usage.

title: ichijou_akari
body:
A character from the [[Bakumatsu Rouman]] series. She is a young [[onmyouji]] in training who can be summon and control evil spirits. She often pulls [[Kanzaki Juuzou]] into her schemes, acting as a "partners in crime" of sorts and carries around an English Dictionary. She also has a doppelganger. She appears as a playable character in [[SNK Gals Fighters]], [[SNK vs Capcom: Match of the Millennium]] (as an unlockable character) and [[Neo Geo Battle Coliseum]].

She's voiced by Onimura Mayuko in the games, and voiced by [[Ueda Kana]] in the pachislot title.

title: regelg
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] franchise. It first appeared in the [[Gundam ZZ]] anime series from 1986.

[b]MS-14J ReGelg[/b]

Its name standing for [b]Re[/b]fined [b]Gelg[/b]oog, it is a modernization of the venerable [[mobile suit]] from [[mobile_suit_gundam|The One Year War]]. Added thrust courtesy of the extra large shoulders, more powerful and versatile weapons and the conversion to a panoramic monitor made the type formidable in combat, almost a full decade after the original [[Gelgoog]] struck fear into the Federation's mobile suits.

title: after_sex

After the act of [[sex|intercourse]] is finished. Telltale signs include [[used tissue|used tissues]] and [[used condom|used condoms]], [[cum]] [[cumdrip|dripping]] out of any particular orifice, and heavy [[blush|blushing]].

Sometimes a character will [[smoking|light up]] a [[cigarette]] while the other [[crying|cries]]. This occurs when a character is [[ruined for marriage]].

If the persons involved are still emotionally focused on each other, and it seems that the sex still hasn't really finished, but is merely winding down, then [[afterglow]] should be used instead. Also note that, while they can coexist, these two tags tend to be mutually exclusive due to reasons of conflicting mood and style.

Try not to confuse this with [[imminent penetration]], which are the moments immediately before sex occurs.

She was sunk by [[mine (place)|mines]] during the "Operation Nordwind (1941)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operation_Nordwind_(1941)].

title: marui_futaba
body:
Series: [[Mitsudomoe (manga)|]]
Also called: Jijo ("second daughter")

One of the three main characters, the Marui triplets. Futaba is the middle triplet but often seems to be from a whole different family. Unlike her sisters, she's endlessly cheerful and outgoing, and shows great affection to their [[Marui Soujirou|father]]. She's a born athlete and dresses the part, going [[barefoot]] almost constantly and wearing her hair in a samurai [[topknot]]. 

Judging by image count, Futaba is the least popular of the triplets for fanart. Ironically, she's an artist herself and apparently has real talent for it -- her art has been known to fool people into thinking it's real. 

(What does she draw? Boobs. On everything. All the triplets are porn fans. Yes, at 12.)

title: marui_hitoha
body:
Series: [[Mitsudomoe (manga)|]]
Also called: Sanjo ("third daughter")

One of the three main characters, the Marui triplets. Hitoha is the youngest, quietest, and most likely to vanish into some dark corner. She's rarely outright mean like Mitsuba, but she has a sort of natural gloomy atmosphere that keeps others at a distance. Generally she's comfortable with that, but not always -- she'd love to share her interest in Gachi Rangers with somebody, and the one friend who [i]does[/i] try to get close is [[Matsuoka Sakiko|an occult freak]] who thinks she's possessed.

title: marui_soujirou
body:
Series: [[Mitsudomoe (manga)|]]

The father of the Marui triplets. He's a great parent who's always looking out for his kids... and unfortunately also a big hairy guy who [i]looks[/i] like he's stalking them. He gets arrested as a pervert on a daily basis. It doesn't help that the girls are sometimes slow to explain the truth, since Futaba's the only one who doesn't find him embarrassing.

title: kuriyama_aiko
body:
Series: [[Mitsudomoe (manga)|]]
Also called: Kuriyamacchi

The Marui triplets' school nurse. In looks and personality, she's every man's dream, especially [[Yabe Satoshi|Yabecchi]]'s -- but she's also a complete airhead who misunderstands things easily (even for a Mitsudomoe character) and is so [[dojikko|clumsy]] she's guaranteed to kill anyone who stands nearby for too long.

title: marui_mitsuba
body:
Series: [[Mitsudomoe (manga)|]]
Also called: Micchan, Choujo ("oldest daughter")

One of the three main characters, the Marui triplets. Mitsuba is the oldest by a matter of minutes; you'd think that wouldn't mean much, but it's gone straight to her head. She's haughty, sadistic, and nasty, a [[tsundere]] with almost no dere. She has the requisite [[twintails]] and is only interested in the opposite sex when there's [[netorare]] potential.

Judging by image count, Mitsuba is the most popular of the triplets for fanart.

title: matsuoka_sakiko
body:
Series: [[Mitsudomoe (manga)|]]

[[Marui Hitoha]]'s best friend... if you can call it friendship. Sakiko is an occult maniac who will stop at nothing to experience paranormal phenomena, to the point where she looked at the gloomy Hitoha and assumed she must be a [i]secret exorcist[/i]. Hitoha has tried to correct her, but between her shyness and Sakiko's zeal, it never works -- so Sakiko just keeps dragging her on one ghost hunt after another.

title: pico_(boku_no_pico)
body:
The titular character of the [[shota]]con OVA series, [[Boku no Pico]].

A [[blonde hair|blonde]], adolescent boy who works part-time at his [[ojiisan_(boku_no_pico)|grandfather's]] bar. Until he meets [[Tamotsu (boku no pico)|]] ("Mokkun") and [[Chico (boku no pico)|]], he has no friends whatsoever or any particular interests aside from swimming. He begins [[crossdressing|wearing girls' clothing]] after Tamotsu buys an outfit for him.

title: tamotsu_(boku_no_pico)
body: A character from [[Boku no Pico]]. Nicknamed "Mokkun" by [[Pico (boku no pico)|]], he's a young man who sexualizes him. Despite taking Pico out on dates, Mokkun essentially views him as a sex object. He is only seen in the first OVA.

title: coco_(boku_no_pico)
body:

title: image_comics
body: Image Comics is an American comic book publisher and is the third largest comic book and graphic novel publisher in the industry in both unit and market share. It was founded in 1992 by several high-profile illustrators as a venue for creator-owned properties, in which comics creators could publish material of their own creation without giving up the copyrights to those properties. Its output was originally dominated by superhero and fantasy series from the studios of the founding Image partners, but now includes comics in many genres by numerous independent creators. Its best-known publications include [[Spawn (comic)|]], Savage Dragon, [[Witchblade]], [[The Walking Dead]], [[Invincible (series)|]], Saga, Jupiter's Legacy, and [[Kick-Ass]]. This publisher founded by Founders Erik Larsen, Jim Lee, Rob Liefeld, Todd McFarlane, Whilce Portacio, Marc Silvestri, & Jim Valentino.

title: shitakiri_souga
body: A 15-year-old boy who attends Mebuki no Sono. He is lively and straightforward, a bullet-like boy who acts before thinking. His behavior is often more childlike than his age suggests, and he sometimes fails to read the room. While he tends to forget what people say, he has the ability to accurately remember anything he sees once. He is Nodoka's stepbrother and is somewhat fed up with his sister's fussing over him.

title: miminashi_yoshikazu
body: An 18-year-old boy who attends Mebuki no Sono. As the oldest in the class, he is the leader. Though he often speaks frivolously and says whatever comes to mind, he is very observant of his classmates and understands them well. However, the way he applies this understanding is often regrettable. He planned a camp before graduation.

title: kukuri_tsuruya
body: The protagonist. A 15-year-old boy who attends Mebuki no Sono. Though he is usually absent-minded and a yes-man who accepts most things, he cares deeply about his classmates and will not compromise on that point. He has a special connection with the mirror of Mebuki no Sono.

title: kiyose_mashiro
body: A 17-year-old boy who attends Mebuki no Sono. His motto is "Friends First," and he consistently dedicates himself to his classmates, often taking the initiative to help out in various ways. He is known as the sensible and conscientious person in the class. However, he also has a unique worldview, which sometimes confuses those around him with the creative games he invents as a hobby.

title: medicine_box
body:
A wicker [[box]] filled with medicine (and possibly one's other possessions) carried on the back, like a [[backpack]].

Usually made of willow or bamboo, but [[Kusuriuri_(mononoke)|]] in [[Mononoke]] and [[Ginko (mushishi)|]] in [[Mushishi]] carry wooden medicine boxes.

title: ginko_(mushishi)
body:
Ginko is the main character from [[Mushishi]]. He employs himself as a Mushi Master, traveling from place to place to research [[mushi_(mushishi)|Mushi]] and aid people suffering from problems caused by them; he rarely comes back to the same location more than once, to reinforce his "wanderer" status. 

He has [[white hair]] and [[green eyes]]. Ginko's attire includes a [[white_shirt|white]] [[dress shirt]] or a [[black coat]]. His [[hair_over_one_eye|hair covers his left eye]] most of the time. He is often seen [[smoking]] a [[cigarette]] or carrying a wooden [[backpack]].


h4. See also
"Mushi-shi Wiki: Ginko":http://mushi-shi.wikia.com/wiki/Ginko

title: ashikari_ibara
body: An 18-year-old who attends Mebuki no Sono. Widely recognized as a beautiful girl, both by herself and others. She has a strong sense of caution, and her attitude and words can be sharp, but she is kind-hearted and honest at her core. Despite everything, she is caring and attentive, so those around her see her as a tsundere. As graduation approaches, she is contemplating various ways to spend her remaining time in class.

title: shitakiri_nodoka
body: A 16-year-old girl attending Mebuki no Sono. She is quiet and passive about everything. Although she has a natural talent and can actually do anything, her usual demeanor leads those around her to perceive her more as an eccentric than an honor student. She is Souga's stepsister, and taking care of her younger brother is the one thing she actively engages in.

title: unyu_hitomi
body: A 14-year-old girl attending Mebuki no Sono. She is timid and shy, but once she gets used to someone, she becomes quite outgoing, though only in familiar settings. She admires Tsuruya and tends to rely on his judgment when she's in trouble. Being the youngest in her class, she often draws attention from those around her.

title: yakisoba_spill
body:
When a character accidentally spills their [[yakisoba]] while draining it.

This is strongly related to a brand of [[cup ramen|cup]] [[instant soba|soba]], "Pe'young Sauce [[yakisoba]]" sold by Maruka Shokuhin. Its reputed nostalgia-evoking flavor has remained unchanged since its introduction in 1975. However, for many years, the container was unfortunately not sufficiently improved, leading to countless accidents in which the noodles spill out while draining the hot water. If you have ever heard a Japanese person say their preparation of yakisoba went wrong, it's more than likely that this product was the culprit, or products of a similar vein. Since then, they finally adopted a more modern type of lid for some of their product lineup that is also used by other brands of yakisoba, where the lid has a dedicated corner that can be peeled to reveal slits that allow only the water to pass through. 

h4. See also

* [[instant soba]]
* [[cup ramen]]
* [[yakisoba]]
* [[Pair&Young Davah (vocaloid)]]

title: camelopardalis_(constellation)
body:
Camelopardalis (the [[Giraffe]]) is a [[constellation]] located in the Northern celestial hemisphere. Its western name, Camelopardalis, comes from the Greek perception of giraffes (lit. spotted camel), while its eastern name is associated with the mythological creature called Qilin. Its brightest star is [i]Beta Camelopardalis[/i].

body:

The manga originally had him with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]], a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[grey shirt]], a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[black jacket|black]] [[blazer]], [[black pants]], and a [[red necktie]] as his [[suit]] but in the anime his appearance was changed to [[red hair|reddish]] [[brown hair]], a [[red shirt]], and a [[white necktie]].

title: cologne_cathedral
body:
A Catholic [[cathedral|basilica]] in Cologne, North Rhine-Westphalia, [[Germany]], officially called the [b][i]Hohe Domkirche Sankt Petrus[/i] (Cathedral Church of Saint Peter)[/b]. It is Germany's most visited landmark.

At 515 feet (157 meters) tall, it was the tallest building in the world for the first 10 years after its completion from 1880 to 1890 and remains the the tallest twin-spired church in the world, the second tallest church in Europe after Ulm Minster, and the third tallest church of any kind in the world.

H4. External Links

* "Official site (German/English)":[https://www.koelner-dom.de/]
* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cologne_Cathedral]

title: countdown
body:
Numbers that are counted backwards in fixed units from an arbitrary starting number to mark the time remaining before an event occurs.

On Danbooru, this usually refers to a series of images an artist or a group of artists draw with a number indicating how many days remain until a new character, event, product or series' [[release date]] or an old one's [[anniversary]] or [[birthday]]. They're usually indicated by "あとX日", meaning "X days left".

It's the opposite of [[event follow-up]], which follows the progress of an event.

Often [[second-party source|posted]] by [[official art|official]] accounts with [[guest art|commissions]] from a variety of popular artists as a way of [[promotional art|promotion]].


h4. Chronological order

* [[announcement celebration]]
* [i]countdown[/i]
* [[release celebration]]
* [[event follow-up]]
* [[ending celebration]]

h4. See also

* [[finger counting]]

title: event_follow-up
body:
A chain of illustrations following the progress of an event, usually the release of an anime. The opposite of [[countdown]] illustrations. For animes, these often follow the release of each individual episode.

For a single standalone illustration celebrating the generic release of the series, use [[release celebration]] instead.

Might be followed by an [[ending celebration]].

Often [[second-party source|posted]] by [[official art|official]] accounts or official  artists as a way of [[promotional art|promotion]].

h4. Chronological order

* [[announcement celebration]]
* [[countdown]]
* [[release celebration]]
* [i]event follow-up[/i]
* [[ending celebration]]

h4. See also

* [[finger counting]]

title: native_american_headdress
body:
Feathered headdress in the style generally worn by Native Americans of the Great Plains, such as the Cheyenne and Sioux. The more ornate ones are also called "war bonnets".

Generally consists of multiple feathers (eagle ones, usually) attached to the top edge of a leather 'headband'.

title: kusazuri
body:
Kusazuri (草摺) are the plated armor skirt commonly seen on traditional Japanese samurai armor, attached at the bottom portion of the [[dou]], the chest armor.  They are composed of a grid of small plates ([i]lamés[/i]) made from laminated leather or iron and riveted together in a fashion similar to [i][[sode]][/i] shoulder guards.

Their role is to protect the waist and upper thighs while still giving flexibility, much like their Western equivalent, [[faulds]] and tassets.  

A related piece of armor is the [[haidate]], a set of similarly-constructed thigh guards worn underneath the [i]kusazuri[/i] but affixed directly to the thighs instead of swinging freely.

The simple cloth equivalents found on kendo [i][[bougu]][/i] training armor are called [i]tare[/i].

h4. See also

* [[List of armor]]
* [[Faulds]]

title: artemisia_argyi
body: Artemisia argyi, commonly known as silvery wormwood or Chinese mugwort, is a herbaceous perennial plant with a creeping rhizome. It is native to China, Korea, Mongolia, Japan, and the Russian Far East (Amur Oblast, Primorye). It is known in Chinese as àicǎo (艾草) or ài yè (艾葉) or ài hao (艾蒿), in Japanese as Chōsen yomogi (朝鮮蓬 [et al.], lit. "Korean wormwood/mugwort") and in Korean as Hwanghae ssuk (황해쑥; 黃海쑥; lit. "Yellow Sea mugwort"). It is used in herbal medicine for conditions of the liver, spleen and kidney.

Original character by [NA](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/325535)

title: sora_kanata
body:
Sora Kanata is a screwed-up girl who calls herself a 'heroine of justice'. Whist trampling everyone beneath her feet. 

Sora defines her gigantic transformation abilities as the power of justice and has developed a fetish for self-made gigantic heroines. She enjoys the screams of people beneath her as they flee from their inevitable demise from the heroine of justice, believing that she is "trampling" the evil around the world. 

She has a sister who goes by the name [[Umi_Kanata|Umi Kanata]]

Original character by [NA](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/325535)

title: toward_the_terra
body:
[b][i]Toward the Terra[/i][/b] (JP: 地球へ… "[i]Terra e...[/i]") is a 1977 [[science_fiction|sci-fi]] manga created by [[Takemiya Keiko]]. Is has been adapted into an anime movie (1980) as well as a animated TV series (2007).

In the future, the planet Earth is a barren husk unable to support life. Humanity has left the planet behind to colonize other worlds. Ruled by a supercomputer that controls childbirth, humans face the emergence of a new race called the "Mu". The Mu live hidden from humanity, dreaming of returning to Terra.

title: watashi_no_koko
body:
Watashi no Koko (formerly Kesson Shoujo) is a fictional experimental / noise / j-pop band from Japan created and managed by Kazuhumi Yosu with artwork generally illustrated by [[Kurage Nanami]] or Yosu himself.
The vocals are produced using an outdated Japanese vocal synthesizer called [[LaLaVoice]], which is personified as the character and core member of the band [[Lala (Watashi no Koko)|Lala]].

title: chuunibyou
body:
Often translated to English as "8th-Grader Syndrome". A similar insult in English is calling someone "[[coldsteel the hedgehog|edgy]]". It is the result of trying to stand out by believing that one has special powers (especially sealed powers), a dark past, or such like. Chuunibyou can manifest as overly dramatic [[hand over eye|hand gestures]], expressions, and spoken lines; and clothing such as [[eyepatch]]es and [[scarf|scarves]]. If the symptoms are severe enough, even [i]actually[/i] having special powers and/or a dark past may not be enough to beat chuunibyou allegations.

Only tag images where a character is actively displaying chuunibyou behavior; do not use simply because the character is a chuunibyou in the series. The tag is not meant as an abbreviation of the light novel series [[Chuunibyou Demo Koi ga Shitai!]].

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Chūnibyō":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ch%C5%ABniby%C5%8D
* "Pixiv Encyclopedia: Chuunibyou":http://en.dic.pixiv.net/a/Chuunibyou
